5.28.19  12:43 pm   What would happen if the sun were to miraculously transform into an onion?

      Like if it was a hot, sunny day, and everything goes dark. You look up, and you just see the biggest onion ever where the sun once was. Would there be a daylight cycle?

      Would all life on Earth perish?

      Would this have any major effect on the rest of the solar system?

     I'm genuinely curious.

Hope all's well where you are!

5.28.19  2:48 am   i've been on a devastatingly long break from creating music (6 months at least), and it's absolutely killing me. i just lost it at the height of my career because of an insane amount of pressure (self-inflicted, mostly) to sound good and be an amazing pianist. also, i've been traveling this week and i'm staying in a house with a few other musicians. tonight i heard someone basically hitting the keys and playing with some cute chords, no recording or end goal or anything, just spending time with the instrument. and it filled me with relief and determination. because i guess ive been waaay too much of a perfectionist- and i've been too afraid to make mistakes while playing, to the point of deleting my confidence to even play. but, if this person can just hit some keys at 2 am and still manage to get some enjoyment and meaning from it, fuck what the hell am i holding back for? i forgot why i even fell in love with music: what the fuck is music and how can i make it myself

5.28.19  2:13 am   in your La dee da day oh song thing (which is amazin' btw) do the lyrics just got home, got no home la-dee-da-de where did it go oh no i can't go home mean like, so you like a girl right, but to get to her (or something) you needa be a rebel against your parents or something XD and you end up getting to her, and a full fulfillment of actually being able to listen to La de Da de Da de Da de Day Oh happily with the good times being now, but you can't get back to your home or whatever cuz/but you got to this girl.

5.27.19  8:08 am   Do you think music is the ultimate art form?

      Because with visual art you get the visuals, that's it. But music can convey ideas with sound and words,

      and visuals that correspond nicely can be added for even more idea conveying.
